title: (x) Looking for a cool "lightning" font - various {gang}
content:
Hi,

I would like your opinion on what's "the best" lightning strike font around. By lightning strike I mean very angular, electrocuted letters, mimicking the movement of a lightning. Think 70's disco music or 00's "electro clash" record sleeves...they use this style a lot, but I was unable to find something as of yet.

Thank you so much! BTW, this site rules.

Have a nice day,  
Geleon
author: Geleon

comments.content:
_Something like_ ' [Pastor Of Muppets](http://web.archive.org/web/20100529175217/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/pastor-of-muppets/)' _( Metallica )_, ' [Pyrite](http://web.archive.org/web/20100529175217/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/pyrite/)' _( Def Leppard ) or_ ' [Squealer](http://web.archive.org/web/20100529175217/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/squealer/)' _( AC/DC )_, _by [Ray Larabie](http://web.archive.org/web/20100529175217/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Ray%2520Larabie)_.?

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20100529175217/http:/www.formlos.net/)

Hi,

thank you fot the links! Pastor of Muppets is pretty cool and closest to what I was envisioning..but it really screams "Metallica" at you. Can't imagine it spelling anything else. Any more?

Cheers  
Geleon

You should also see this thread

[http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/53493.html?1100290729](http://web.archive.org/web/20100529175217/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/53493.html?1100290729 "http://www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/53493.html?1100290729")

I think 'normally' most of these band logos / record sleeves are 'handmade' and may as well not be based on existing typefaces..

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20100529175217/http:/www.formlos.net/)

pattyfab, thanks!

Aarco is good. And formlos, you are right, probably making a word look like a lightning strike is more of a illustrator's job than just typesetting...

Another idea might be to use something like [GothicGothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20100529175217/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeco/gothic-gothic/) from TypeCo and play with the skew of each letter.
